data.title: Friendsgiving: 15 Best Easy Recipes for Cozy Evening
data.description: Enjoy 15 easy and cozy Friendsgiving recipes perfect for your holiday gathering, including savoury sides, desserts, and festive drinks that cater to all tastes.
data.intro:
Friendsgiving is a festive and relaxed spin on Thanksgiving that lets you celebrate with friends over a creative, personalized meal. On Recipes No Limits, you can build your Friendsgiving recipes from the ingredients you already have, making the occasion truly unique and fun. With easy Friendsgiving meals, savoury Thanksgiving side dishes, and holiday potluck ideas, this gathering becomes a chance to share, experiment, and enjoy. Whether serving classic dishes like roasted turkey or exploring vegetarian Thanksgiving options, Friendsgiving is about crafting a menu that brings everyone together.

From cheesy casseroles and fall-inspired salads to decadent Thanksgiving desserts, the table can blend traditional and new recipes. Each guest can bring their favourite dish, adding to the excitement and variety of the feast. Friendsgiving’s potluck style makes it easy to try dishes from different culinary backgrounds and dietary choices—perfect for the spirit of community that defines the holiday.

For those who enjoy hosting, creating a well-rounded Friendsgiving spread can include more than just main courses and sides. Try experimenting with signature Thanksgiving drinks, like festive cocktails or seasonal non-alcoholic options, to elevate the celebration. And for dessert, the options are endless, from pies and pecan bars to inventive pastries that embrace fall flavours. With Recipes No Limits, every Friendsgiving dish can be customized and crafted to fit your gathering, making this holiday meal one that’s both delicious and memorable.

So, if you're looking for a way to embrace both comfort and creativity, gather your friends and enjoy the chance to share your favourite Friendsgiving recipes. Whether it’s your first Friendsgiving or a beloved tradition, this gathering celebrates the joy of food, friendship, and flavours that everyone can enjoy together.

meal.name: Loaded Green Bean Casserole
meal.quickTastyDescription: A creamy and cheesy twist on the classic green bean casserole, loaded with flavor and topped with crispy onions.
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the green beans, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Stir until well mixed.
Add 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese to the mixture and stir again.
Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish, spreading it evenly.
Top with the remaining 1 cup of cheddar cheese and then sprinkle the French fried onions on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
meal.detailedName: Loaded Green Bean Casserole with Cheddar and Crispy Onions
meal.modifiersForBase: Loaded with Cheddar and Topped with Crispy Fried Onions

meals.description: Loaded Green Bean Casserole is a delicious twist on the classic dish, featuring tender green beans, crispy onions, and a creamy, flavorful sauce. Perfect for Thanksgiving or any holiday meal, this easy casserole is a crowd-pleaser. With its rich taste and comforting texture, it's a must-try recipe for your Friendsgiving or family gathering. Enjoy a festive side that everyone will love, offering both comfort and a touch of gourmet flair.

meal.name: Roasted Turkey with Herb Butter
meal.quickTastyDescription: Juicy turkey infused with aromatic herb butter for a delicious holiday feast.
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C).
In a bowl, mix softened butter with chopped herbs, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Pat the turkey dry with paper towels and gently loosen the skin over the breast and thighs.
Spread the herb butter mixture under the skin and all over the turkey's exterior.
Season the cavity of the turkey with salt and pepper, and place a halved lemon, onion, and a few herb sprigs inside.
Truss the legs and tuck the wings under the turkey.
Place the turkey on a rack in a roasting pan, breast side up.
Roast the turkey for about 3-4 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Baste the turkey with pan juices every 30 minutes for a golden skin.
Let the turkey rest for at least 20 minutes before carving.

meals.description: This Roasted Turkey with Herb Butter is a succulent centerpiece for your Friendsgiving feast. Infused with a flavorful herb butter, the turkey comes out golden, crispy on the outside, and tender inside. It’s the perfect main dish for your holiday gathering, offering a savory, juicy alternative to other festive meals. Whether it's for Thanksgiving or a Friendsgiving celebration, this easy recipe will impress your guests and elevate your spread. Enjoy a flavorful, hassle-free turkey that pairs beautifully with all your holiday sides.

meal.name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Olive Oil and Garlic
meal.quickTastyDescription: Crispy, caramelized Brussels sprouts infused with garlic and olive oil – a simple yet delicious side dish!
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
Trim the ends of the Brussels sprouts and remove any yellow or damaged leaves.
Cut the Brussels sprouts in half and place them in a large bowl.
Add the olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper to the bowl. Toss until the sprouts are well coated.
Spread the Brussels sprouts out on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on the edges, tossing halfway through for even cooking.
Remove from the oven and serve warm.
meal.detailedName: Oven Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Garlic and Olive Oil

meals.description: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Olive Oil and Garlic is a simple yet flavorful side dish for your Friendsgiving celebration. These crispy, caramelized sprouts are tossed in garlic-infused olive oil for a savory bite that pairs perfectly with your Thanksgiving mains. Ideal for guests seeking a healthy, delicious alternative, this easy recipe adds a touch of elegance to any holiday meal. A must-try for your Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving spread, it’s a great addition to your collection of quick and tasty holiday side dishes.

meal.name: Apple Crumble Pie
meal.quickTastyDescription: Warm, sweet apples under a crunchy crumble topping, perfect for dessert!
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, mix the sliced apples with sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice until well combined.
Place the apple mixture into the pie crust.
In another bowl, combine the flour, oats, brown sugar, and melted butter to create the crumble topping.
Sprinkle the crumble mixture evenly over the apples in the pie crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the topping is golden brown.
Let it cool slightly before serving.

meals.description: Apple Crumble Pie is the perfect dessert to add a sweet touch to your Friendsgiving celebration. With its warm, spiced apple filling and a buttery, crispy crumble topping, this pie is a crowd-pleaser. A delightful alternative to traditional pies, it’s a must-have for your Thanksgiving or Friendsgiving dessert table. Easy to make and full of comforting flavors, this dessert is sure to become a holiday favorite that complements your savory sides and festive drinks. Enjoy this classic, indulgent treat with friends and family.

meal.name: Spinach Artichoke Dip

ingredients.name: artichoke hearts, canned, drained and chopped

meal.quickTastyDescription: A creamy, cheesy dip packed with flavor, perfect for parties or a cozy night in!
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, and mayonnaise until smooth.
Stir in the thawed spinach, chopped artichoke hearts, Parmesan cheese, and half of the mozzarella cheese.
Add the garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste, mixing well.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and top with the remaining mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until the dip is bubbly and the cheese is melted.
Serve warm with tortilla chips, pita bread, or vegetable sticks.

meals.description: Spinach Artichoke Dip is a creamy, cheesy appetizer that's perfect for Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving gatherings. Packed with spinach, artichokes, and a savory blend of cheeses, this dip is a crowd favorite. It’s easy to prepare and can be served warm with crackers, bread, or veggies. Whether you're hosting a casual Friendsgiving potluck or looking for a party appetizer, this dip is sure to be a hit. Its rich flavor and comforting texture make it an ideal choice for your holiday spread.

meal.name: Honey Glazed Carrots
meal.quickTastyDescription: Sweet, tender carrots coated in a delicious honey glaze that makes for a perfect side dish!
detailedCookingInstructions: Wash and peel the carrots, then cut them into thin slices or sticks.
In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the sliced carrots to the skillet and stir for about 2 minutes.
Pour in the honey, salt, pepper, and water. Stir to combine.
Cover the skillet and let the carrots simmer for about 15 minutes, or until they are tender, stirring occasionally.
Once the carrots are cooked, remove the lid and let the glaze thicken for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve warm and enjoy!

meals.description: Honey Glazed Carrots are a sweet and savory side dish perfect for Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving. The natural sweetness of carrots is enhanced by a rich honey glaze, making this simple recipe a crowd favorite. With a tender texture and glossy finish, these carrots complement holiday mains and add a burst of color to your festive spread. Whether you’re hosting or attending a Friendsgiving potluck, this dish is an easy, flavorful addition to your holiday menu.

meal.name: Pumpkin Pasta Alla Vodka
meal.quickTastyDescription: Creamy and comforting pasta with a hint of pumpkin and a splash of vodka, perfect for a cozy dinner.
detailedCookingInstructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the vodka and let it simmer for a couple of minutes to cook off the alcohol.
Stir in the pumpkin puree and heavy cream, mixing well until combined and heated through.
Add in the cooked pasta and toss to coat in the sauce. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes if using.
Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan or herbs if desired.
meal.modifiersForBase: with pumpkin and vodka cream sauce

meals.description: Pumpkin Pasta Alla Vodka is a creamy, rich dish that blends the fall flavors of pumpkin with the smoothness of vodka sauce. Perfect for a Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving dinner, this unique twist on traditional pasta offers a savory, seasonal option for your holiday table. The silky sauce pairs beautifully with the pasta, creating a comforting and indulgent meal. Serve this dish for a crowd-pleasing vegetarian option that’s ideal for your festive gathering.

meal.name: Honeycrisp Apple Cider
meal.quickTastyDescription: A refreshing, sweet, and slightly tart drink perfect for fall or any season!
detailedCookingInstructions: Wash and core the Honeycrisp apples, then cut them into quarters.
In a large pot, combine the apple quarters and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Once boiling, reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
After 30 minutes, use a potato masher or a fork to mash the apples to release more juice.
Strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth into a large bowl or pitcher to remove the solids.
Stir in the brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and nutmeg (if using) until the sugar is dissolved.
Serve warm or chilled, and enjoy your delicious homemade Honeycrisp apple cider!
meal.modifiersForBase: Using Honeycrisp apples for a sweeter flavor

meals.description: Honeycrisp Apple Cider is a refreshing and sweet drink that perfectly captures the essence of fall. Ideal for your Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving celebration, this cozy beverage combines the crispness of Honeycrisp apples with a blend of spices for a warm, inviting drink. Whether served hot or chilled, it’s a crowd-pleasing option that pairs wonderfully with both savory and sweet dishes. Add this to your holiday menu for a seasonal drink that everyone will love, offering a comforting and festive touch to your gathering.

meal.name: Sausage and Herb Stuffing
meal.quickTastyDescription: A savory stuffing packed with sausage and fresh herbs, perfect for any holiday meal or family gathering.
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and celery, cooking until softened (about 5 minutes).
In the same skillet, add the Italian sausage, breaking it apart with a spoon, and cook until browned and cooked through.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the bread cubes, cooked sausage mixture, chicken broth, parsley, sage, thyme, salt, and pepper. Mix well until the bread is evenly coated.
Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the top is golden and crispy.

meals.description: Sausage and Herb Stuffing is a savory and flavorful side dish perfect for your Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving celebration. Combining hearty sausage, aromatic herbs, and a golden, crispy texture, this stuffing is a comforting classic that complements turkey and other holiday mains. Whether baked in a casserole or stuffed into the bird, it’s a must-have addition to your festive spread. This easy recipe brings the warmth of the season to your table, making it an essential part of your holiday meal.

meal.name: Cheesy Mashed Potato Casserole
meal.quickTastyDescription: A creamy, cheesy delight that turns simple mashed potatoes into a comforting casserole.
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, 1 cup of cheddar cheese, green onions, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix until smooth and creamy.
Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Spread the remaining 1 cup of cheddar cheese on top of the potato mixture.
Dot with butter on top for extra richness.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
meal.modifiersForBase: Cheese, Sour Cream, and Green Onions

meals.description: Cheesy Mashed Potato Casserole is a creamy, indulgent side dish that’s perfect for your Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving feast. Loaded with cheese and buttery mashed potatoes, this comforting casserole is a crowd favorite. Topped with a crispy golden crust, it’s a delicious way to elevate your holiday meal. Whether served alongside turkey, ham, or roasted vegetables, this easy and cheesy dish will add a savory richness to your festive spread, making it a must-try recipe for any holiday gathering.

meal.name: Blue Cheese and Pear Flatbread
meal.quickTastyDescription: A delightful flatbread topped with creamy blue cheese, sweet pears, and a drizzle of honey for a perfect balance of flavors.
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the flatbread on a baking sheet.
Drizzle olive oil over the flatbread and spread it evenly.
Crumble blue cheese over the flatbread.
Arrange the sliced pear on top of the cheese.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and drizzle with honey.
Top with chopped walnuts and arugula if using.
Slice and serve warm.
meal.modifiersForBase: Topped with blue cheese and pear

meals.description: Blue Cheese and Pear Flatbread is a unique and flavorful appetizer perfect for your Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving gathering. The combination of tangy blue cheese and sweet pears creates a delicious contrast, while the crispy flatbread provides a perfect base. This easy-to-make recipe offers a gourmet touch to your holiday spread, making it ideal for guests seeking something different. Serve it as a starter or side dish to impress your friends and family with its sophisticated yet simple flavors. Perfect for any festive occasion.

meal.name: Cranberry Brie Bites
meal.quickTastyDescription: Deliciously creamy brie with sweet and tart cranberry sauce, all wrapped in flaky pastry.
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut into squares, about 3 inches each.
Place a small piece of brie cheese in the center of each pastry square.
Top each piece of brie with a spoonful of cranberry sauce.
Fold the corners of the pastry over the filling and pinch to seal, forming a small pocket.
Place the filled pastry bites on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Beat the egg and brush it over the tops of the pastry bites for a golden finish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving. Garnish with fresh thyme if desired.
meal.modifiersForBase: Add nuts or herbs for extra flavor

meals.description: Cranberry Brie Bites are a delicious, bite-sized appetizer that combines creamy Brie and sweet cranberry sauce, perfect for adding a touch of sophistication to your Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving gathering. These flaky pastry cups are easy to prepare and offer a delightful mix of savory and sweet, making them a great addition to your holiday menu. Whether served as a starter or a party snack, these elegant morsels are sure to impress your guests with their flavor and festive appeal.

meal.name: Pull-Apart Pesto Turkey Sliders
meal.quickTastyDescription: Savory turkey sliders infused with aromatic pesto, perfect for easy gatherings!
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the turkey slider patties according to package instructions until fully cooked (about 5-7 minutes per side). Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Slice the slider buns in half horizontally without separating them. Place the bottom halves in a baking dish.
Spread a layer of pesto sauce over the bottom halves of the buns.
Place the cooked turkey patties on top of the pesto, followed by slices of mozzarella cheese.
Cover with the top halves of the buns and brush the tops lightly with olive oil.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the buns are golden brown.
Remove from the oven, let cool for a minute, then cut into individual sliders. Garnish with fresh basil leaves if desired.

meals.description: Pull-Apart Pesto Turkey Sliders are a delicious and easy-to-serve appetizer for your Friendsgiving or holiday gathering. These savory sliders are filled with tender turkey and aromatic pesto, all nestled between soft, fluffy rolls. Perfect for a festive meal, they offer a fun and flavorful way to serve up turkey in a new way. Ideal for potlucks or casual get-togethers, these sliders are a great addition to your holiday menu, providing a tasty balance of herby, savory, and savory flavors in each bite.

meal.name: Cheesy Beef Nachos
meal.quickTastyDescription: Crispy tortilla chips topped with seasoned beef, melted cheese, and fresh toppings for a delicious snack or meal!
detailedCookingInstructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Add the taco seasoning to the beef, following the packet instructions (usually adding water and simmering).
On a large baking sheet, spread out the tortilla chips evenly.
Spoon the seasoned beef over the chips, then sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and top with diced tomatoes, jalapeños, and green onions.
Serve warm with sour cream on the side. Enjoy!

meals.description: Cheesy Beef Nachos are the ultimate comfort food for your Friendsgiving or holiday party. Piled high with seasoned beef, melted cheese, and topped with fresh ingredients, these nachos are perfect for sharing. Easy to make and full of bold flavors, they’re an ideal dish for casual gatherings or potlucks. Serve them as an appetizer or a fun main course, and enjoy this crowd-pleasing favorite at your next festive event. Whether you're hosting or bringing a dish, these nachos are sure to be a hit!

meal.name: Simple Apple Cranberry Sauce
meal.quickTastyDescription: A sweet and tart sauce perfect for holiday meals or as a delicious topping for breakfast.
detailedCookingInstructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the cranberries, chopped apple, sugar, and water.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat and let simmer for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries burst and the mixture thickens.
If desired, stir in cinnamon for added flavor.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly before serving.

meals.description: Simple Apple Cranberry Sauce is a fresh and tangy twist on a classic holiday side. Perfect for Friendsgiving or Thanksgiving, this easy recipe combines the sweetness of apples with the tartness of cranberries, creating a deliciously balanced sauce. It’s a simple, homemade accompaniment that pairs wonderfully with turkey, stuffing, or any holiday spread. With its vibrant flavors and easy preparation, this sauce is a great way to elevate your festive meal and add a burst of seasonal flavor to your gathering.

data.conclusion:
Friendsgiving is a wonderful opportunity to gather with friends and enjoy delicious, comforting dishes. From savoury appetizers to sweet treats, these recipes offer something for everyone to enjoy. Whether you’re hosting or contributing to the meal, these dishes will make your gathering memorable. Celebrate the season with flavorful, easy-to-make recipes that add warmth and joy to your festive spread. Don’t forget to get creative and make your Friendsgiving meal your own!

Recipes No Limits is a platform that empowers users to create personalized dishes using the ingredients they have on hand. It allows you to explore a wide variety of meal options based on what’s available in your kitchen, making it easier to cook with what you already have. Whether you're looking to try something new or simply need inspiration, this website provides endless possibilities for home cooks, offering both simple and more advanced recipes tailored to your pantry's contents.
